## 1. Voice Access: Command Your PC with Just Your Words

Imagine navigating your entire computer‚Äîopening apps, writing emails, and even scrolling‚Äîusing nothing but your voice. That‚Äôs exactly what **Voice Access** brings to the table.

- **What it does:**
Voice Access listens to your commands and translates them into actions. You can say ‚ÄúOpen Word,‚Äù ‚ÄúClick Start,‚Äù or ‚ÄúType Hello‚Äù and it just works.

This feature isn‚Äôt just about accessibility‚Äîit can make your workflow faster and reduce reliance on the keyboard or mouse.

### How to Enable Voice Access

1. Press **Win + I** to open **Settings**.
2. Go to **Accessibility** > **Speech**.
3. Turn on **Voice Access**.
4. Download the language pack when prompted (usually English (US) is available first).
5. Once enabled, say commands like:
- ‚ÄúOpen Word‚Äù

## 2. Eye Control: Navigate with Just a Glance

Have you ever wished you could control your computer with your eyes? Windows 11 makes that science-fiction idea a reality with **Eye Control** (requires a compatible eye-tracking device).

- **What it does:**
Eye Control lets you move the cursor, type text, or even launch apps simply by looking at different parts of the screen.
- **Best for:**
Users with motor impairments, or anyone curious about the future of human-computer interaction.
- **Pro tip:**
Pair Eye Control with predictive text to type faster than you‚Äôd expect with only eye movements.

It‚Äôs not just accessibility‚Äîit‚Äôs also a glimpse into the **next generation of computing interfaces.**

### How to Enable Eye Control

1. Connect your **eye-tracking device** to your PC.
2. Press **Win + I** to open **Settings**.
3. Go to **Accessibility** > **Eye Control (beta)**.
4. Toggle the switch to **On**.
5. Calibrate your eyes by following the on-screen dots.

üí° **Pro tip:** Pair Eye Control with predictive text to type faster using just your eyes.

## 3. Speech Access: Communicate Beyond Words

While Voice Access focuses on controlling your PC, **Speech Access** (part of Windows‚Äô broader speech recognition tools) helps users dictate text, issue commands, and interact naturally with apps.

- **What it does:**
Converts spoken words into written text across applications‚Äîgreat for emails, reports, or notes.
- **Best for:**
Students, writers, professionals on the go, and anyone looking to reduce typing strain.
- **Pro tip:**
Customize speech shortcuts for repetitive tasks to save time during long writing sessions.

### How to Enable Speech Recognition

1. Press **Win + H** to open the **dictation toolbar**instantly.
- Or open **Settings** > **Accessibility** > **Speech** > **Windows Speech Recognition**.
2. If prompted, download the speech pack.
3. Start dictating into any text field by speaking directly.

üí° **Pro tip:** Create **voice shortcuts** for repetitive phrases‚Äîgreat for emails, reports, or coding notes.

These are the kinds of tools that make Windows 11 feel **personal, inclusive, and ahead of its time.**
